meanings.definition: A title of respect for a man, used in formal address or in the third person.
meanings.sent1: The gentleman was addressed as esquires during the formal event.
meanings.sent2: The esquires were invited to the exclusive club for a special gathering.
meanings.sent3: At the fancy dinner, everyone jokingly called him esquires, making him feel important.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the lead actor's character was an esquires, symbolizing his high status.
meanings.sent5: The title of esquires added a touch of elegance to his name.

meanings.definition: A young nobleman serving as an attendant to a knight.
meanings.sent1: The esquires assisted the knight in preparing for battle.
meanings.sent2: In the medieval times, esquires were trained in the art of combat.
meanings.sent3: The young esquires were eager to prove their loyalty to the knight.
meanings.sent4: The esquires' dedication to their duties shone brightly in the castle.
meanings.sent5: Every aspiring knight dreamed of having loyal esquires by their side.
